sub_title: Studying wind energy in the urban environment
summary:
I'm a sociologist who focuses on the future of wind energy in cities. I'm particularly interested in innovative designs and concepts of wind turbines that go beyond the classical large, vertical wind turbine and can be integrated into the urban environment in a creative way. 

My research is a part of the Horizon 2020 zEPHYR (https://www.h2020-zephyr.eu/) project that examines the possibilities for the efficient exploitation of urban wind energy resources.

authors.headline: Studying wind energy in the urban environment

profile_positions.description:
Project title 'Reassembling urban low-carbon futures through wind energy imaginaries'

In the context of ongoing urban energy transitions, an increasing number of city governments have demonstrated interest in producing wind energy in cities. The deployment of urban wind energy systems gives rise to multiple visions of how cities with extensive presence of wind turbines might look like in the future. These visions set in motion transformations of various urban systems. 

My PhD project investigates how visions of urban wind energy futures open up new ways of integrating wind energy in the urban environment. It interrogates how these visions affect the (re)design of buildings, infrastructure networks, and public spaces in cities.

This PhD project is a part of a larger Horizon 2020 project zEPHYR: Towards more efficient exploitation of on-shore and urban wind energy resources.
profile_positions.title: PHD Candidate
ESR fellow within the Energy-SHIFTS project

profile_positions.description:
Moscow Urban Forum is Russia’s largest international congress on urban development with 10,000+ participants annually held since 2011

Responsibilities included: 
• Designed MUF’s 2018 and 2019 concepts, wrote descriptions of 50+ sessions, executed the event (2 days, 70+ events), including tracks on sustainability, green urban infrastructure, and smart urbanization 
• Served as an account leader for mayors, deputy mayors of Moscow and other cities (Antwerp, Barcelona, Tel Aviv), top officials of international organizations (UN-Habitat), internationally renowned architects (Rem Koolhaas, Winy Maas, Stefano Boeri), business representatives (CISCO, Philips)
• Expanded and managed a network of international and local partners, including EOCD, Green Building Council, Dutch and French Embassies in Russia
• Managed partnership relations with UN-Habitat. Developed the concepts of and executed joint events, including Urban October and Executive Training ‘Essentials of Urban Policies and Planning for Sustainable Cities’ for senior government officials from the CIS
• Prepared proposal presentations, reports for clients and partners upon their request, developed policy recommendations for the Moscow Government based on Forum’s discussions
• Led a team of 3 full-time employees and 2-5 external contractors
profile_positions.title: Deputy Programme Director

profile_positions.description:
• Conducted research and developed the concept of the Forum's programme
• Executed the Forum's programme (Director of the 'City of the Future' Day)
• Liaised with co-organizers, partners, and speakers
• Negotiated the programme content with the representatives of the Moscow Government, including Department for Environmental Management and Protection, Department of Information Technologies, Moscow Agency of Innovations
profile_positions.title: Senior Programme Manager

profile_positions.description:
At the European Humanities University, I was affiliated with the Laboratory of Critical Urbanism, which is a platform for scholars and practitioners in the Post-Soviet region working in the field of urban studies 

• Developed the programme of and taught the course ‘Urban STS. Technology, Infrastructure, and the City’ within the Critical Urban Studies MA programme
• Conducted research within the project ‘Sources of Urbanity in a Post-Nuclear/Post-Industrial Town’. Conducted interviews, analyzed official documents and newspaper materials, wrote an academic paper
• Co-organized the events of the Laboratory of Critical Urbanism, including conference panels, lectures, workshops, winter and summer schools

Between November 2012 and October 2014, I took the position of a Student Research Coordinator.

Responsibilities included: 
• Acted as the day-to-day coordinator of the Student Research Center, in close collaboration with the directors of other Research Centers at the University
• Developed a student research agenda in accordance with the overall University’s research strategy
• Took responsibility for financial and administrative management of student research projects
profile_positions.title: Assistant Lecturer, Junior Researcher, Student Research Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
Skolkovo Foundation is an innovation cluster that includes business incubators, accelerators, R&D centers, start-ups, and a university

• Organized major pieces of large international tech conferences held by Skolkovo (Open Innovations Forum, Startup Village), regional conferences (Startup Tour, Asian Science Parks Conference) as well as international partnerships, including Barcelona Smart City Expo
• Designed and executed a top-level Russia-Singapore conference on smart city with the participation of Deputy Prime Minister Shuvalov, Deputy Prime Minister Tharman, CEO of Govtech Singapore
• Developed a concept for Open Innovations Forum 2018 based on the Triple Helix concept 
• Developed and executed the programme for the Startup Tour, major Russia-wide roadshow with 15+ 2-day events that brings together startups, entrepreneurs, and investors
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

volunteer_experiences.description:
